channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Nine new cases of Covid-19, five in the community - Ministry of Health
item.description: Another five new cases of Covid-19 have been identified in the community today, all linked to the Auckland cluster. Four further cases have been found in isolation.

item.title: Fire at disused Mataura paper mill storing potentially toxic waste
item.description: A fire has broken out at the former Paper Mill building in Mataura, where toxic aluminium waste is stored.

item.title: Police setting up $9m facial recognition system which can identify people from CCTV feed
item.description: Police have been quietly setting up a $9 million facial recognition system that can take a live feed from CCTV cameras and identify people from it.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 31 August
item.description: Doctors say keeping Auckland at alert level 3 for longer would have kept people healthier.

item.title: Weather a challenge for Aoraki/Mt Cook fire, say firefighters
item.description: Fire and Emergency NZ say a southerly change later in the day could increase the fire's speed by two to four times.

item.title: Siouxsie Wiles, Michael Baker urge mask wearing to control Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: New Zealanders will need to wear masks and get tested "the minute they have any symptom" of Covid-19 for the country to control the latest cluster under lower alert levels, Dr Siouxsie Wiles says.

item.title: Fire service battles blaze in Oamaru
item.description: Several fire teams including two helicopters have been working to bring a scrub fire under control on the outskirts of Oamaru this morning.

item.title: Spike in KiwiSaver hardship withdrawals - Public Trust
item.description: There has been a 20 percent spike in the number of people applying to withdraw from their KiwiSaver funds, on the grounds of significant financial hardship.

item.title: Activists block fertiliser trucks leaving Richmond plant
item.description: Police are at the scene of a fertiliser plant in the Tasman where protesters have locked themselves to the gates.

item.title: Crunch time for Victoria University's restructuring plans
item.description: Members of Victoria University's governing council have expressed distrust and sadness over a controversial and now-abandoned restructuring project.

item.title: Auckland kids heading back to school, but not all are convinced it's safe
item.description: With about 250,000 children returning to school in Auckland today, teachers and parents are divided over whether they should be going back at all.

item.title: Crews battle Aoraki/Mt Cook fire for second day
item.description: A large fire in the Aoraki/Mt Cook area is believed to have been started by a hunter knocking over a camp stove.

item.title: Fight to protect Hamilton's rare bats heads to Environment Court
item.description: Environmentalists worried a population of bats could be pushed to extinction by a housing development are taking their fight to court.

item.title: Covid-19: PM 'incredibly angry' over wrong call for South and West Auckland testing
item.description: The government encouraged hundreds of thousands in Auckland to get a Covid-19 test, but the PM says this was an oversimplification and she was "incredibly angry" about the mixed messages.

item.title: Evacuations halted as scrub fire burns out of control near Mt Cook Aoraki
item.description: Four firefighting teams and a command unit will stay overnight at the scene of a large scrub fire in the Mackenzie Basin, in the hope of saving any property in its path.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 30 August
item.description: As Auckland prepares to move to "alert level 2.5" from midnight, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern warns New Zealanders to expect more cases for some time.

item.title: New Zealand Tasmanian tiger pelt provides DNA of extinct marsupial
item.description: A Tasmanian tiger pelt found in New Zealand has caused excitement in Australia.

item.title: Restoring the forest: 'Negative interactions are really important'
item.description: Restoring forest ecosystems need to include bringing back both the good and bad animal species and plants.
